com.github.gwtd3.api.svg
Class Axis

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.github.gwtd3.api.svg.Axis
All Implemented Interfaces:
IsFunction
public class Axis
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
implements IsFunction

D3’s axis component displays reference lines for Scales automatically.

This lets you focus on displaying the data, while the axis component takes care of the tedious task of drawing axes and labeled ticks.

The axis component is designed to work with D3’s QuantitativeScale, TimeScale and OrdinalScale scales.

Author:
Anthony Schiochet, citaire

See Also:
orient(Orientation)

orient

public final Axis orient(Axis.Orientation o)
Sets the axis orientation and returns the axis.

The orientation of an axis is the position of the ticks and their labels in relation to the axis path.

For a vertical axis, specify Axis.Orientation.LEFT or Axis.Orientation.RIGHT; for a horizontal axis, specify Axis.Orientation.TOP or Axis.Orientation.BOTTOM.

If instead you want to determine the position of the axis with respect to the plot, use the transform attribute.

Parameters:
o - the orientation
Returns:
the current axis

ticks

public final Axis ticks(int count)
Specify the argument that will be passed to the associated scale Scale#ticks() method to compute the tick values. This version specify the desired tick count.

The count parameter is also passed to the Scale#tickFormat(int, String) method to generate the default tick format.

This version suits for LinearScale and LogScale.

Parameters:
count - the argument to be passed to the underlying scale.
Returns:
the current axis

innerTickSize

public final Axis innerTickSize(int innerTickSizeInPixels)
Sets the inner tick size to the specified value and returns the axis.

The inner tick size controls the length of the tick lines, offset from the native position of the axis.

Parameters:
innerTickSizeInPixels - the new value
Returns:
the current axis

innerTickSize

Returns:

outerTickSize

public final Axis outerTickSize(int outerTickSizeInPixels)
Sets the outer tick size to the specified value and returns the axis.

The outer tick size controls the length of the square ends of the domain path, offset from the native position of the axis.

Thus, the “outer ticks” are not actually ticks but part of the domain path, and their position is determined by the associated scale's domain extent.

Thus, outer ticks may overlap with the first or last inner tick. An outer tick size of 0 suppresses the square ends of the domain path, instead producing a straight line.

Parameters:
outerTickSizeInPixels - the new value
Returns:
the current axis

outerTickSize

public final int outerTickSize()
Returns:
the current outer ticks size, which defaults to 6

tickSubdivide

@Deprecated

Deprecated. this method has no effect anymore !

Get the tick subdivision count, which defaults to zero.

Returns:
the tick subdivision count

tickSubdivide

@Deprecated
public final Axis tickSubdivide(int count)
Deprecated. this method has no effect anymore ! use

Set the tick subdivision count and returns the axis.

Sets the number of uniform subdivision ticks to make between major tick marks. The specified count specifies the number of minor ticks, which is one less than the number of subdivisions.

For example, axis.tickSubdivide(1) produces one minor tick per major tick, thus cutting the space between each major tick in two. As another example, decimal subdivision is specified as axis.tickSubdivide(9).

Parameters:
count - the tick subdivision count
Returns:
the current axis

tickFormat

public final Axis tickFormat(DatumFunction<String> formatFunction)
Set the function to be used to format tick values.

This method can be used for example to add prefix or suffix to the result of a Formatter.format(double) method.

Note: the given function of context argument will be null instance, and the index will be -1.

Parameters:
formatFunction - the function converting each tick value to a String.
Returns:
the current Axis

tickFormat

public final Formatter tickFormat()
Returns the current format function, which defaults to null. A null format indicates that the Scale's default formatter should be used, which is generated by calling Scale#tickFormat(int). In this case, the arguments specified by ticks are likewise passed to scale tickFormat.

Parameters:
format - the tick value formatter for labels.
Returns:
the current axis.

tickValues

public final Array<?> tickValues()
Return the currently-set tick values, which defaults to null.

Returns:
the currently-set tick values

tickValues

public final Axis tickValues(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject values)
Specify the values to be used for ticks, rather than using the scale's automatic tick generator.

If values is null, clears any previously-set explicit tick values, reverting back to the scale's tick generator.

The explicit tick values take precedent over the tick arguments set by axis.ticks. However, any tick arguments will still be passed to the scale's tickFormat function if a tick format is not also set; thus, it may be valid to set both axis.ticks and axis.tickValues.

Parameters:
values - the values to be used for ticks
Returns:
the current axis

tickValues

Alias for tickValues(JavaScriptObject).

Parameters:
values - the values
Returns:
the current axis
